wrappy package¶

Module contents¶

Decorators for common Python developer utility.

wrappy.args_as_string(*args, **kwargs)¶

Turn arguments and keyword arguments into a string representation.

Parameters

  • args – each member must support __repr__().

  • kwargs – order-insensitive, each member must be serializable.

Returns

str – string representation of all arguments.

wrappy.get_caller_name(skip=2)¶

Get the name of a caller in the format module.class.method.

Parameters

skip (int) – the number of call stack levels to skip.

Returns

str – “<module>.<class>.<method>” or “<module>.<function>”.

wrappy.guard(fallback_retval=0, fallback_func=None, print_traceback=False)¶

Wraps a try-except block around a function, with a fallback return value or function. If supplied, the fallback function must be callable and will override the fallback value.

Parameters

  • fallback_retval (any) – the return value to use when getting an exception.

  • fallback_func (callable) – the alternative function to call when getting an exception.

  • print_traceback (bool) – whether to show the traceback information when getting an exception.

Returns

callable – a parametrized decorator.

Here’s a trivial usage example:

@guard(fallback_retval=0)
def divide(a, b):
    return a / b
wrappy.memoize(cache_limit=1000)¶

Memoize the output of a function with an OrderedDict for least-recently-used(LRU) caching.

Parameters

cache_limit (int) – the maximum number of distinct inputs to memoize.

Returns

callable – a parametrized decorator.

wrappy.probe(show_caller=False, show_args=False, show_kwargs=False, show_returns=False, random_theme=True)¶

Builds a customized decorator that prints information at runtime.

Parameters

  • show_caller (bool or int) – whether to show the caller(s) of the decorated function, and how many levels to show.

  • show_args (bool) – whether to show the argument values of the decorated function.

  • show_kwargs (bool) – whether to show the keyword argument value of the decorated function.

  • show_returns (bool) – whether to show the return value of the decorated function.

  • random_theme (bool) – whether to use a random color scheme for better distinguishment against other ‘probed’ functions.

Returns

callable – a parametrized decorator.

wrappy.todo(message='This functions is not yet implemented.')¶

Mark a function as to-do so that it throws an error when called.

Parameters

message (str) – the error message to display.

Returns

callable – a parametrized decorator.
